    • Method Detail

      • delAz

        public static double delAz(Hypocenter hypo,
                           Station sta)
        An historically significant subroutine from deep time (1962)! This routine was written by Bob Engdahl in Fortran (actually in the days before subroutines) and beaten into it's current Fortran form by Ray Buland in the early 1980s. It's optimized with respect to computing sines and cosines (probably still worthwhile) and it computes exactly what's needed--no more, no less. Note that the azimuth is returned in static variable azimuth.
        Parameters:
        hypo - Hypocenter object
        sta - Station object
        Returns:
        Distance (delta) in degrees

      • ttResModel

        public static double ttResModel(double residual,
                                double median,
                                double spread)
        The canonical Buland statistical model for travel-time residuals is a linear combination of a Gaussian and a Cauchy distribution. In practice, the canonical model must be adapted for the median and spread of the phase of interest. This method then calculates the value of the phase probability density function at the desired residual.
        Parameters:
        residual - Travel-time residual in seconds
        median - Median probability density function time in seconds for the desired phase
        spread - Probability density function spread in seconds for the desired phase
        Returns:
        Probability density function value for the desired residual

      • deltaCorr

        public static double deltaCorr(double delta)
        Compute a crude correction to the figure-of-merit to make phase identifications at near distances more likely. This is principally a problem for the closest station to a subduction event due to the complex structure. It should only be applied to the first arrival in any pick group.
        Parameters:
        delta - Distance in degrees
        Returns:
        Correction to the phase association figure-of-merit

      • getRayTime

        public static java.lang.String getRayTime(double time)
        Produce a time string from a Hydra time suitable for printing. Hydra uses doubles instead of longs, but (conveniently) the same epoch. The string returned is valid to milliseconds and uses 24-hour times.
        Parameters:
        time - Hydra date-time stamp
        Returns:
        Time string

      • getRayDate

        public static java.lang.String getRayDate(double time)
        Produce a date-time string from a Hydra time suitable for printing. Hydra uses doubles instead of longs, but (conveniently) the same epoch. The string returned is valid to milliseconds and uses 24-hour times.
        Parameters:
        time - Hydra date-time stamp
        Returns:
        Date-time string
